> [beenotung](#comment_46_1DLBhCccN3MbM5YmzNS2UfBzDkEZkGZtVg): (please correct me if I get it wrong)

"(please correct me if I get it wrong)", "Combining zeronet and ipfs seems to be a good idea."   maybe.. but combining zeronet and qbittorrent or even plain utorrent, if you may, would be even better. BitTorrent with web seeders are more permanent than ipfs, such web seeders can be hosted by nextcloud, or even zeronet or freenet (if it's running). Before a post is high profile enough to attract attention for censorship to web seeders, it likely will be popular enough for several peer seeders to back em liberty up

> [caropc1v22](#comment_10_1Mk11Va4hvFzWgfAhvyRJR4m6buvWENcBZ): kopy kate big and big kopy kate 2, use torrent technology in video [...]

Zeronet may be the most fun darknet, and great for small files, but let's face it, it doesn't handle large files like videos well. If the video is not popular it never gets seeded. Here is a fun challenge. See if someone could post Red Dead Redemption, or the Lord of the Rings trilogy [in one video] on Zeronet and have it work. I dare you!

I am quite tech experienced and have come to the conclusion after years of darknet research that the best solution for platform based internet freedom is to make a Zite as kind of a central hub for all your content (due to the dynamic support Zeronet has), and put all your posts on qBitTorrent + web seeders.

The zite should be as light weight as possible and just contain links to your posts elsewhere. The web seeders of choice can be any website direct download link a normal browser can access at a given time. I recommend NextCloud, or Mega.nz, or Freenet, or Zeronet. For popular posts the web seeders are bypassed altogether.

Usually the videos you post on Zeronet are fake and only play for yourself and not for anyone else. Try moving the zeronet folder to rubbish bin and reInstalling zeronet and refresh the page, and behold, it never plays, for it did not pass further than your own computer, that is no seeders. It's literally no better than saving the video on your hard drive and opening in VLC and pretending its accessible over the web.   :-b

1599847995_1G4bDXzgDecBgPWKafP8J9zFGNsPe.body: You can get around websites detecting your suspicious IP by popping a web proxy into tor browser, although then recaptcha wont work. Btw if anyone knows a webproxy that works with recaptcha plz send me the link. Every website has the right to choose whether they allow anonymous users or try to stop it. But I disagree with torproject making it so easy to block the exits (btw, there is not a single country that can completely block entry bridges as of September 2020)
